verses.kjv: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.
verses.ct: A message about the desert by the sea: Like windstorms sweeping through the southern desert, it comes from the wilderness, from a terrifying land.

verses.kjv: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.
verses.ct: A devastating vision has been revealed to me: the betrayer betrays, and the destroyer destroys. Attack, Elam! Lay siege, Media! I will put an end to all the groaning she has caused.

verses.kjv: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.
verses.ct: Because of this, my body is racked with pain. Agony grips me like a woman in labor. I am staggered by what I hear; I am horrified by what I see.

verses.kjv: My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure hath he turned into fear unto me.
verses.ct: My heart races wildly, and terror overwhelms me. The evening I longed for has been turned into a night of dread for me.

verses.kjv: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.
verses.ct: They set the table, they post the lookout, they eat and drink — then suddenly the cry goes out: 'Get up, you commanders! Oil your shields for battle!'

verses.kjv: For thus hath the LORD said unto me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he seeth.
verses.ct: The LORD told me this: 'Go, station a lookout and have him report whatever he sees.'

verses.kjv: And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearkened diligently with much heed:
verses.ct: He spotted a column of riders — pairs of horsemen, a caravan of donkeys, and a caravan of camels. He watched closely, paying very careful attention.

verses.kjv: And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually upon the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights:
verses.ct: Then the lookout shouted like a lion: 'My lord, I stand at the watchtower constantly during the day, and I take my post every single night.

verses.kjv: And, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.
verses.ct: Now look — here comes a column of men with pairs of horsemen!' Then he announced, 'Babylon has fallen — fallen! Every carved image of her gods has been smashed to the ground.'

verses.kjv: O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.
verses.ct: My people who have been crushed like grain on the threshing floor — what I have heard from the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, I have passed on to you.

verses.kjv: The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?
verses.ct: A message about Dumah: Someone calls out to me from Seir, 'Watchman, how much of the night is left? Watchman, how much of the night is left?'

verses.kjv: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will enquire, enquire ye: return, come.
verses.ct: The watchman answers, 'Morning is coming, but so is another night. If you want to ask again, come back and ask.'

verses.kjv: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.
verses.ct: A message about Arabia: You caravans of Dedanites will have to camp in the thickets of Arabia.

verses.kjv: The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled.
verses.ct: The people of the land of Tema brought water to the thirsty and met the refugees with food.

verses.kjv: For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.
verses.ct: They were fleeing from swords — from drawn swords and bent bows — from the brutal intensity of war.

verses.kjv: For thus hath the LORD said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:
verses.ct: The LORD told me this: 'Within exactly one year, measured precisely like a hired worker's contract, all the splendor of Kedar will come to an end.'

verses.kjv: And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the LORD God of Israel hath spoken it.
verses.ct: The surviving archers, the warriors of Kedar's descendants, will be reduced to very few. The LORD, the God of Israel, has declared it.
